{{BLP sources|date=June 2011}}
'''Claudia Carawan''' (born April 19, 1959, [[Alexandria, Virginia]], [[United States]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[singer-songwriter]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=NOBLAAAAIBAJ&sjid=VYsDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6610,1759665&dq=claudia-carawan&hl=en|title=Jazz vocalist stars with the Blue Beats|last=Zitz|first=Michael|date=March 12, 1992|work=[[Free Lance-Star]]|accessdate=18 June 2011}}</ref> and [[pianist]]. Although she has been creating and performing music for more than 20 years, it took until 2003 before she released her debut album, ''[[Out of the Blue (Claudia Carawan album)|Out of the Blue]]''. It derives its sound from several styles including [[soul music|soul]], [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[reggae]] and [[jazz]]. Her [[human voice|voice]] draws comparisons with [[Bonnie Raitt]] and [[Eva Cassidy]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} Carawan is a cousin of the folk musician [[Guy Carawan]].

==Discography==
* ''[[Out of the Blue (Claudia Carawan album)|Out of the Blue]]'' (2003)
* ''[[Fearless (Claudia Carawan album)|Fearless]]'' (2008)
* Joy Rising (2013)
